title: AST must decode single/double quotes correctly in strings
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/353

Using the test from https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/merge_requests/977, but the latest master of LFortran, here is the test and its AST:
```console
$ cat tests/string.f90
program string
implicit none
character(50) :: str
    str = "Hi, I'm using string"
    str = 'Use "Double" "quote"'
    str = "'random'' ab''cd""fg''h'ij""klmno'pqr's'''"
    str = 'random'' a"b''cd""fg""hij"kl"mno"p"qr"s'''
    str = """equal''"
    str = '"Double" ''Quote'''
    str = "'Single' ""Quote"""

    print *, "Hi, I'm using string"
    print *, 'This is a "sting"'
    print *, "'random'' ab''cd""fg''h'ij""klmno'pqr's'''"
end program
$ lfortran --show-ast tests/string.f90
(TranslationUnit [(Program string [] [(ImplicitNone [])] [(Declaration (AttrType TypeCharacter [(() 50 Value)] ()) [] [(str [] [] () None ())])] [(= 0 str (Str "Hi, I'm using string")) (= 0 str (Str "Use "Double" "quote"")) (= 0 str (Str "'random'' ab''cd""fg''h'ij""klmno'pqr's'''")) (= 0 str (Str "random'' a"b''cd""fg""hij"kl"mno"p"qr"s''")) (= 0 str (Str """equal''")) (= 0 str (Str ""Double" ''Quote''")) (= 0 str (Str "'Single' ""Quote""")) (Print 0 () [(Str "Hi, I'm using string")]) (Print 0 () [(Str "This is a "sting"")]) (Print 0 () [(Str "'random'' ab''cd""fg''h'ij""klmno'pqr's'''")])] [])])
```
Let's take the lines:
```fortran
    str = '"Double" ''Quote'''
    str = "'Single' ""Quote"""
```
Currently the AST contains the following strings for them:
```
"Double" ''Quote''
'Single' ""Quote""
```
That's a bug. It should contain:
```
"Double" 'Quote'
'Single' "Quote"
```
This should be fixed in the tokenizer itself, as it knows if single or double quotes were used for the string. It should just decode it, and keep it as a string.
